item.title: Repeated fly-tipping of bulky waste Hillcourt Road, 22nd July
item.description:
Someone has been regularly dumping large household items on the pavement near the bins outside. This time it includes a bathtub and other bulky waste. It’s blocking the pavement and making the area look neglected. This has become a recurring issue and is really frustrating for residents. Please investigate and arrange for prompt removal, ideally take steps to prevent it happening again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goodrich Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter not cleared, 22nd July
item.description:
A large amount of empty bottles and cans behind seat by car park and tissues stuck in fence. Reported in June. Yesterday this was reported as RESOLVED. Today it has clearly not been resolved, unless RESOLVED means WE HAVE DECIDED IT IS ACCEPTABLE.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsmead Close, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4 x barriers left over from Pride, 22nd July
item.description:
4 x barriers have been left since the Pride celebrations a couple of weeks ago. They are currently dumped outside our building on Upper James Street, are blocking the pavement for pedestrians, and are at risk of blocking out fire exit. Please can these be collected/removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-3, Upper James Street, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Thames Water leak not fixed after repair, 22nd July
item.description:
Thames Water "fixed" the leak on High Road two days a go but it is still leaking. They left the road to deteriorate to an unacceptable and dangerous state, please do not let them get away with it again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 152-164, High Road, New Southgate, London
Report on FixMyStreet
